alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Upper Sevier River Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of southwestern Garfield and north central Kane Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorm outflow winds 12 miles northeast of Bryce Canyon National Park, or 25 miles west of Escalante, moving nort at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated and surface observation confirmed. At 449PM MDT, a wind gust to 61 mph was reported at Bryce Canyon Airport. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Red Canyon, Bryce Canyon National Park, Tropic, Cannonville and Rubys Inn. This includes Utah Route 12 between mile markers 2 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Upper Sevier River Valleys
